title: National mental-health survey finds widespread ignorance, stigma

title_detail.value: National mental-health survey finds widespread ignorance, stigma

summary: Less than half of Americans can recognize anxiety. Most people don't know what to do about depression even when they spot it. And nearly 8 in 10 don't recognize prescription drug abuse as a treatable problem.

summary_detail.value: Less than half of Americans can recognize anxiety. Most people don't know what to do about depression even when they spot it. And nearly 8 in 10 don't recognize prescription drug abuse as a treatable problem.
